result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Gerald A Reeve was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Gerald A Reeve was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by defendant/counsel.

DA Jane Kohlwey appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person with Atty Rich Davis.  No contest plea to Ct 1 and Ct 2.  Count 3 dismissed.  On Ct 1, sentence withheld, placed on 3 years probation.  6 months jail with huber commencing 3-16-15 @ 7 PM.  May serve in Dane County on E M P.  Fine $2452.00 including $250.00 DNA surcharge. Provide DNA sample. $65.00 Blood draw Reimbursement, 36 month revocation, 36 month IID, AODA and comply. Ct 2:  $$518.00 fine/costs to be paid in within 1st year or probaiton.  Not to possess/consume alcohol, AODA and comply.  Provide DNA sample.  4 days jail credit.
Associated with Charge #1

Jury trial on February 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gerald A Reeve in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Defendant Gerald A Reeve in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Davis requesting Preliminary Hearing be scheduled,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Gerald A Reeve, appeared in custody, with Atty Amanda Riek.. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,000 recog. bond with felony conds., not operate motor vehicle without valid drivers license, absolute sobriety while operate motor vehicle, not possess/consume alcoholic beverages. Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:40 pm.  Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
